intro: Phthirusa coarctata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed phthirusa, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun exposure. Its small, white or yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Phthirusa coarctata is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
